inventory_metadata.purpose: Claude Code CLI Wiring Diagram Application

microcontrollers.name: Arduino Uno R3

warnings: Do not exceed 20mA per I/O pin
Total current from all I/O pins should not exceed 200mA
Vin must be 7-12V; lower causes instability, higher causes overheating

solutions: Try different USB cable with data lines

microcontrollers.ai_summary: 5V Arduino microcontroller with ATmega328P, 14 digital I/O (6 PWM), 6 analog inputs. Most widely supported, beginner-friendly. Use USB-B or 7-12V barrel jack for power.

microcontrollers.name: Arduino Mega 2560 R3

causes: Using SPI pins for other purposes
solutions: Reserve pins 50-53 for SPI devices only

causes: Using Serial1/2/3 pins for digital I/O
solutions: Use Serial.begin() for USB, Serial1/2/3.begin() for hardware UARTs

microcontrollers.ai_summary: 5V Arduino with ATmega2560, 54 digital I/O (15 PWM), 16 analog inputs, 4 hardware serial ports. Use for projects needing many pins or multiple serial devices.

microcontrollers.name: ESP32 DevKit 38-Pin

do_not_use_pins.reason: Connected to internal SPI flash - WILL CRASH

strapping_pins.reason: Affect boot mode - use with caution

warnings: NOT 5V TOLERANT - use level shifter for 5V sensors
GPIO6-11 are reserved for internal flash - DO NOT USE
GPIO34/35/36/39 are input-only
ADC2 unavailable when WiFi is active

causes: GPIO0 not pulled LOW during reset
solutions: Hold BOOT button while pressing EN/RST

causes: Insufficient USB power during WiFi TX

common_issues.problem: Random crashes when using certain pins
solutions: Check strapping pin states at boot

microcontrollers.ai_summary: 3.3V dual-core WiFi+Bluetooth MCU. NOT 5V tolerant - requires level shifter for 5V sensors. Avoid GPIO6-11 (flash). Input-only: GPIO34/35/36/39. Powerful but requires attention to pin selection.

microcontrollers.name: NodeMCU ESP8266 Amica V2

safe_gpio.reason: No boot conflicts, safe for any use

boot_sensitive.D3/GPIO0: Must be HIGH at boot (pulled up internally)
boot_sensitive.D4/GPIO2: Must be HIGH at boot (built-in LED)

warnings: NOT 5V TOLERANT - 3.3V logic only
D3/D4/D8 affect boot mode - don't pull LOW at startup
GPIO6-11 reserved for flash - DO NOT USE
Only 1 ADC pin (A0) with 0-1V range (scaled to 0-3.3V on module)

common_issues.problem: Won't boot with sensor on D3/D4/D8
causes: Boot pin pulled to wrong state by sensor

microcontrollers.ai_summary: 3.3V WiFi MCU, breadboard-friendly (23mm row spacing). NOT 5V tolerant. Safe pins: D1/D2/D5/D6/D7. Avoid D3/D4/D8 for sensors (boot-sensitive). Only 1 ADC.

microcontrollers.name: SparkFun Blynk Board
microcontrollers.ai_summary: ESP8266 board with pre-loaded Blynk firmware, onboard WS2812 RGB LED on GPIO4, and 10K thermistor on ADC. Quick IoT prototyping.

microcontrollers.name: DCCduino Nano

warnings: Requires CH340G driver installation

solutions: Install CH340G driver from WCH website

microcontrollers.ai_summary: Arduino Nano clone with CH340G USB chip. Requires CH340 driver. 5V logic, breadboard-friendly form factor.

sensors.name: HC-SR04 Ultrasonic Sensor

esp32.note: ESP32 is 3.3V - Echo outputs 5V, needs divider!

esp8266.note: NodeMCU is 3.3V - use 1K+2K voltage divider on Echo

warnings: Echo pin outputs 5V - use voltage divider for 3.3V MCUs
Minimum 60ms between measurements to avoid echo interference
10μs minimum trigger pulse required

solutions: Use hard flat surfaces for testing
Add voltage divider: 1K + 2K resistors on Echo line

sensors.ai_summary: 5V ultrasonic distance sensor, 2-400cm range. Requires 2 digital pins (Trig output, Echo input). Use voltage divider on Echo for 3.3V MCUs. Min 60ms between readings.

sensors.name: HC-SR501 PIR Motion Sensor

warnings: Allow 60 seconds warmup after power-on
2.5 second lockout after output goes LOW
Avoid mounting near heat sources or AC vents

sensors.ai_summary: PIR motion sensor, 3-7m adjustable range, 110° cone. Output is 3.3V (safe for all MCUs). Requires 60s warmup. Use interrupt pin for responsive detection.

sensors.name: DHT11 Temperature & Humidity Module

warnings: Minimum 1 second between readings (1Hz max)
Use 3.3V power for 3.3V MCUs
Pull-up resistor required if not on module

common_issues.problem: Always returns NaN or checksum errors

solutions: Read no more than once per 2 seconds

libraries.basic_code: DHT dht(DHTPIN, DHT11); dht.begin(); float t = dht.readTemperature();

sensors.ai_summary: Temperature (0-50°C ±2°C) and humidity (20-90% ±5%) sensor. Single-wire protocol (NOT I2C). Max 1 reading per second. Use DHT library.

sensors.name: GY-521 MPU6050 6-DOF IMU

warnings: Module has onboard 3.3V regulator - safe for 5V VCC
I2C lines are 3.3V - use level shifter if MCU needs 5V I2C
AD0 pin selects address: GND=0x68, VCC=0x69

libraries.arduino: MPU6050 by Electronic Cats or I2Cdevlib

sensors.ai_summary: 6-axis IMU (3-axis accel + 3-axis gyro) on I2C bus. Address 0x68 (AD0=GND) or 0x69 (AD0=HIGH). Has onboard DMP for sensor fusion. Use I2C scanner to verify connection.

sensors.name: DS3231 RTC Module

warnings: RTC address 0x68 conflicts with MPU6050 default - change MPU AD0 if using both
Install CR2032 battery for backup
Some modules charge the battery - use non-rechargeable CR2032 or remove charging diode

solutions: Install fresh CR2032 with + facing up
Change MPU6050 to 0x69 by connecting AD0 to VCC

libraries.basic_code: RTC_DS3231 rtc; rtc.begin(); DateTime now = rtc.now();

sensors.ai_summary: Precision RTC (±2ppm) with I2C at 0x68. Includes 4KB EEPROM at 0x57 and CR2032 backup. NOTE: Same I2C address as MPU6050 - change MPU AD0 if using both.

sensors.name: RC522 RFID Module

arduino_uno.note: Module is 3.3V but most clones work with 5V Arduino SPI

warnings: VCC is 3.3V ONLY - 5V will damage the module
SPI pins are 3.3V tolerant
Antenna coil is fragile - don't bend PCB

sensors.ai_summary: 13.56MHz RFID reader on SPI bus. 3.3V ONLY - will be damaged by 5V! Includes card and keychain fob. Use MFRC522 library.

sensors.name: KY-023 Joystick Module

esp32.note: Use 3.3V for ESP32 - output will be 0-4095 (12-bit)

solutions: Calibrate in software - read center position at startup

sensors.ai_summary: Dual-axis analog joystick with center button. Uses 2 analog pins + 1 digital. Center position ~512 on Arduino. Button is active LOW.

sensors.name: KY-040 Rotary Encoder
sensors.ai_summary: 20-detent rotary encoder with quadrature output and push button. Use interrupt pins for CLK/DT for reliable counting.

sensors.name: Photoresistor (LDR)
sensors.ai_summary: Light sensor using voltage divider. Higher light = lower resistance = higher analog reading. Use 10K resistor to GND.

sensors.name: Soil Moisture Sensor

warnings: Probes corrode quickly in wet soil - don't leave powered constantly

sensors.ai_summary: Capacitive soil sensor. A0 gives analog reading (lower = wetter). Power only when reading to extend probe life.

sensors.name: Flame Sensor Module
sensors.ai_summary: IR flame sensor. Detects 760-1100nm wavelength (fire). D0 for threshold detection, A0 for intensity.

sensors.name: Water Level Sensor
sensors.ai_summary: Conductive water level sensor. Analog output proportional to water height. Power intermittently to reduce electrolysis.

sensors.name: KY-038 Sound Sensor
sensors.ai_summary: Sound detection module. A0 for analog level, D0 for threshold detection (clap sensor). Adjust sensitivity with pot.

sensors.name: IR Obstacle Avoidance Sensor
sensors.ai_summary: IR proximity sensor. Output LOW when obstacle in range. Adjust range with pot. Works 2-30cm typical.

sensors.name: SW-520D Tilt Switch

wiring_rules.connection: Acts as SPST switch - use with pull-up resistor

sensors.ai_summary: Ball-type tilt switch. Closes circuit when tilted past threshold. Use INPUT_PULLUP, reads LOW when tilted.

actuators.name: SG90 Micro Servo

warnings: Stall current can exceed 500mA - use external power for multiple servos
Never power from MCU 5V pin if using more than 1 servo
Common GND between servo power supply and MCU required

common_issues.problem: Servo jitters or doesn't hold position

causes: Servo drawing too much current from Arduino 5V
solutions: Power servo from external 5V supply, share GND with Arduino

actuators.ai_summary: 180° micro servo, 9g. PWM control: 1ms=0°, 1.5ms=90°, 2ms=180°. Use external 5V supply for multiple servos. Brown=GND, Red=VCC, Orange=Signal.

actuators.name: 28BYJ-48 Stepper Motor with ULN2003 Driver

warnings: Motor draws ~240mA - use external power supply
Driver LEDs show which coil is active
Gear train makes motor slow but high torque

solutions: Use Stepper library with correct pin order
Disable motor when not moving (call stepper.release())

libraries.basic_code: Stepper myStepper(2048, IN1, IN3, IN2, IN4); myStepper.setSpeed(10); myStepper.step(2048);

actuators.ai_summary: 5V geared stepper, 4096 steps/rev, ~15 RPM max. Requires 4 digital pins + ULN2003 driver. Use external 5V power. AccelStepper library for smooth motion.

actuators.name: L293D Motor Driver IC

warnings: Chip gets HOT - heatsink recommended above 400mA
Ground pins (4,5,12,13) also act as heatsink - solder to large copper area
Internal diodes protect against back-EMF but add voltage drop

solutions: Add heatsink or copper pour under chip

common_issues.problem: Motor doesn't run in both directions
solutions: Connect enable pins to 5V or PWM pin

actuators.ai_summary: Dual H-bridge motor driver IC. 600mA/channel. Pin 16=5V logic, Pin 8=motor voltage (4.5-36V). Enable pins control on/off or PWM speed. Gets hot - add heatsink.

actuators.name: 5V Relay Module

load_side.no: Normally Open - connects to COM when relay energized
load_side.nc: Normally Closed - connects to COM when relay off

warnings: DANGER: Load side can carry mains voltage - use extreme caution
Keep high voltage wiring away from low voltage Arduino circuits
Active LOW: digitalWrite(pin, LOW) turns relay ON
Relay coil draws ~70mA - within Arduino pin limit but use transistor for multiple relays

common_issues.problem: Relay clicks but doesn't switch load
solutions: Wire load between COM and NO or NC as needed
Module has built-in protection but add 100uF cap on Arduino 5V

actuators.ai_summary: 5V relay module with optocoupler isolation. Active LOW trigger. Load terminals: COM (common), NO (normally open), NC (normally closed). CAUTION: Can switch mains voltage.

displays.name: LCD 1602 Module

warnings: Contrast (V0) must be adjusted - display may appear blank without it
Use 10K potentiometer between VDD and VSS, wiper to V0
I2C backpack reduces wiring from 12+ pins to 4 pins

common_issues.problem: Display shows boxes or is blank
solutions: Adjust V0 potentiometer until text visible

displays.ai_summary: 16x2 character LCD. Parallel mode needs 6+ pins; I2C backpack needs only 2 (SDA/SCL). MUST adjust contrast pot (V0) or display appears blank.

displays.name: MAX7219 8x8 LED Matrix Module

wiring_rules.cascading: Connect DOUT of first module to DIN of second

libraries.basic_code: LedControl lc(DIN, CLK, CS, 1); lc.setLed(0, row, col, true);

displays.ai_summary: 8x8 LED matrix with MAX7219 driver. SPI interface, cascadable for larger displays. 5V operation, 16 brightness levels.

logic_interface.name: HW-221 Logic Level Converter
logic_interface.ai_summary: 4-channel bidirectional level shifter. Connect LV to 3.3V reference, HV to 5V reference, share GND. Works for I2C, SPI, UART up to ~400kHz.

logic_interface.name: 74HC595 Shift Register

libraries.basic_code: shiftOut(dataPin, clockPin, MSBFIRST, data); digitalWrite(latchPin, HIGH);

logic_interface.ai_summary: 8-bit serial-to-parallel shift register. Expands 3 pins to 8 outputs. Cascadable for more outputs. Use shiftOut() function.

power_prototyping.name: MB102 Breadboard Power Supply

wiring_rules.input: DC barrel jack 6.5-12V OR USB (not both)
wiring_rules.output: Plugs directly into breadboard power rails
wiring_rules.jumpers: Set each rail independently to 3.3V or 5V
warnings: Do not use barrel jack and USB simultaneously
Max 700mA total - don't overload

power_prototyping.ai_summary: Breadboard power module with independent 3.3V/5V rails. Input: 6.5-12V barrel jack or USB. Max 700mA total. Use jumpers to select voltage per rail.

power_prototyping.name: 830-Point Solderless Breadboard
power_prototyping.ai_summary: Standard 830-point breadboard. Center channel for DIP ICs. 4 power rails (2 per side). Check rail continuity - some boards have breaks in the middle.

power_prototyping.name: 400-Point Mini Breadboard
power_prototyping.ai_summary: Half-size 400-point breadboard. Good for small circuits or mounting on project bases.

power_prototyping.name: Jumper Wire Assortment
power_prototyping.ai_summary: Jumper wire kit with M-M, M-F, and F-F connectors. M-M for breadboard, M-F for Arduino headers to breadboard, F-F for sensor modules.

power_prototyping.name: 9V Battery Barrel Jack Adapter
power_prototyping.ai_summary: 9V battery clip with 2.1mm barrel plug. Center positive - compatible with Arduino barrel jack. ~500mAh capacity typical.

shields.name: L293D Motor Shield

wiring_rules.stacking: Plugs directly onto Arduino Uno headers
wiring_rules.power_jumper: Remove to use separate motor power supply

shields.ai_summary: Arduino motor shield with 2x L293D. Drives 4 DC motors OR 2 steppers + 2 servos. Uses pins 3-12. Use external power for motors >6V.

shields.name: CNC Shield V3 (GRBL)
shields.ai_summary: GRBL CNC shield for 3-4 axis control. Accepts A4988/DRV8825 drivers. Use with GRBL firmware for G-code control.

shields.name: Arduino Prototyping Shield
shields.ai_summary: Proto shield with small breadboard area for custom circuits. Good for making permanent Arduino add-ons.

shields.name: Screw Terminal Shield
shields.ai_summary: Breaks out all Arduino Uno pins to screw terminals for secure, solderless connections.

shields.name: 2.8" TFT LCD Shield (ILI9341)
shields.ai_summary: 2.8" 240x320 color TFT with ILI9341 controller. SPI interface. Use Adafruit_GFX + Adafruit_ILI9341 libraries. Optional touch + SD card.

audio.name: Piezo Buzzer

wiring_rules.connection: One pin to digital output (PWM), other to GND

audio.ai_summary: Passive piezo buzzer. Use tone(pin, frequency) to play sounds. Loudest at resonant frequency (~2.4kHz).

audio.name: 8Ω Mini Speaker

wiring_rules.direct: Through transistor amplifier (TIP120) or audio amp module
wiring_rules.warning: Do NOT connect directly to Arduino pins - will damage pin

audio.ai_summary: 8Ω 0.5W speaker. Requires amplifier - do NOT connect directly to MCU pins. Use PAM8403 module or transistor driver.

discrete_semiconductors.name: TIP120 Darlington Transistor
discrete_semiconductors.ai_summary: NPN Darlington, 5A/60V. High gain (1000) - can drive from MCU pin via 1K resistor. ALWAYS use flyback diode with motors/solenoids.

discrete_semiconductors.name: 2N2222 NPN Transistor
discrete_semiconductors.ai_summary: General purpose NPN transistor. TO-92 pinout: E-B-C (flat side facing you). Good for switching up to 800mA loads.

discrete_semiconductors.name: IRF520 MOSFET Module

warnings: Not fully ON at 3.3V gate - use 5V MCU or logic level MOSFET
Module handles gate drive, not bare MOSFET

discrete_semiconductors.ai_summary: MOSFET module for PWM control of high-current loads. Works with 5V logic. Use for LED strips, motors up to 9A. Not ideal for 3.3V MCUs.

capacitors.name: Electrolytic Capacitor Assortment
capacitors.ai_summary: Electrolytic caps 1-470uF. POLARIZED - long leg is positive. Common uses: 100uF on power rails, 10uF on sensor modules.

capacitors.name: Ceramic Capacitor Assortment
capacitors.ai_summary: Ceramic caps. Non-polarized. 100nF (104) most useful - place near every IC VCC pin for decoupling.

leds.name: 5mm LED Assortment

wiring_rules.polarity: Long leg = Anode (+), Short leg / Flat side = Cathode (-)

leds.ai_summary: 5mm LEDs. Long leg = positive. Use resistor: 150Ω for red/yellow/green at 5V, 68Ω for blue/white at 5V.

leds.name: WS2812B Addressable LED Strip

common_issues.problem: First LED wrong color or flickering

leds.ai_summary: 60 LEDs/m addressable RGB strip. 5V power (60mA per LED = 3.6A for 60 LEDs!). Use FastLED library. Add 1000uF cap + 470Ω data resistor.

leds.name: RGB LED (Common Cathode)

wiring_rules.resistors: Use separate resistor for each color (150Ω typical at 5V)
wiring_rules.connection: Cathode to GND, anodes to PWM pins via resistors

leds.ai_summary: 4-pin RGB LED. Longest leg = common cathode (GND). Use PWM on each color pin for mixing. analogWrite(pin, 0-255) for each color.

bulk_passives.name: Resistor Assortment Kit
bulk_passives.ai_summary: 1/4W resistor kit. Most used: 220Ω (LEDs), 1K-10K (pull-ups, base resistors), 4.7K (I2C). Use color code calculator if unsure.

bulk_passives.name: 10K Potentiometer
bulk_passives.ai_summary: 10K linear pot. As voltage divider: outer pins to GND/VCC, wiper to analog pin. Reads 0-1023 on Arduino.

bulk_passives.name: Tactile Pushbutton Assortment
bulk_passives.ai_summary: Tactile buttons. Use INPUT_PULLUP mode, connect other side to GND. Button pressed = LOW. Add debounce (10-50ms delay).

bulk_passives.name: Header Pin Assortment
bulk_passives.ai_summary: 2.54mm pitch headers. Break to length needed. Male for breadboard insertion, female for module sockets.

accessories.name: Dupont Jumper Wires
accessories.ai_summary: Dupont jumper kit. M-M for breadboard, M-F for Arduino headers to breadboard, F-F for connecting modules with male headers.

accessories.name: USB Cable Set
accessories.ai_summary: USB cables for programming. USB-B for Uno/Mega, Mini-USB for Nano, Micro-USB for ESP boards.

accessories.name: DC Barrel Jack Connectors
accessories.ai_summary: 2.1mm barrel jacks for Arduino-compatible power. Center positive standard.

accessories.name: Heat Shrink Tubing Assortment
accessories.ai_summary: Heat shrink tubing kit. Use heat gun or lighter to shrink. Insulates solder joints and wire splices.

accessories.name: M3 Standoff/Spacer Kit
accessories.ai_summary: M3 standoff kit for mounting Arduino/PCBs. Standard Arduino hole spacing uses M3.

accessories.name: Header Pin Assortment
accessories.ai_summary: 2.54mm header pins. Break to length. Male for breadboard insertion, female for socket connections.

accessories.name: Prototype PCB Assortment
accessories.ai_summary: Perfboard PCBs for permanent projects. 2.54mm pitch matches headers and DIP ICs.

accessories.name: PCB Screw Terminal Blocks
accessories.ai_summary: Screw terminals for power and motor connections. Solder to PCB, accept bare wire.

accessories.name: Alligator Clip Test Leads
accessories.ai_summary: Alligator clip leads for temporary connections and testing. Don't use for permanent wiring.

accessories.name: Multimeter Test Probes
accessories.ai_summary: Replacement/upgrade multimeter probes with interchangeable tips.

robot_obstacle_avoider.name: Robot Obstacle Avoider
robot_obstacle_avoider.description: Simple robot that detects and avoids obstacles

weather_station.name: WiFi Weather Station
weather_station.description: IoT weather monitor with web dashboard

smart_plant_monitor.name: Smart Plant Watering System
smart_plant_monitor.description: Automated plant watering based on soil moisture

game_controller.name: USB Game Controller
game_controller.description: Custom game controller with joystick and buttons

data_logger.name: Environmental Data Logger
data_logger.description: SD card data logger with timestamp

i2c_address_conflicts.resolution: Change MPU6050 AD0 to HIGH for 0x69

mutually_exclusive_pins.conflict: SPI uses pins 10-13, can't use for other digital I/O during SPI
GPIO1,3 used for Serial, GPIO6-11 for flash

ascii_pinouts.esp32_devkit_38:
┌───────────────────────────────────────────┐
│              ESP32 DevKit 38-Pin          │
│     ┌─────────────────────────────┐       │
│     │         ESP-WROOM-32        │       │
│     │      ┌─────────────┐        │       │
│     │      │   Antenna   │        │       │
│     └──────┴─────────────┴────────┘       │
│                                           │
│ LEFT SIDE              RIGHT SIDE         │
│ ┌────┬─────┐          ┌─────┬────┐        │
│ │3V3 │ 3.3V│          │ GND │ GND│        │
│ │EN  │Reset│          │IO23 │MOSI│        │
│ │VP  │ IO36│◄IN ONLY  │IO22 │ SCL│        │
│ │VN  │ IO39│◄IN ONLY  │TX0  │ IO1│        │
│ │IO34│◄────│IN ONLY   │RX0  │ IO3│        │
│ │IO35│◄────│IN ONLY   │IO21 │ SDA│        │
│ │IO32│     │          │GND  │ GND│        │
│ │IO33│     │          │IO19 │MISO│        │
│ │IO25│ DAC1│          │IO18 │ SCK│        │
│ │IO26│ DAC2│          │IO5  │ SS │ ⚠BOOT  │
│ │IO27│     │          │IO17 │    │        │
│ │IO14│     │          │IO16 │    │        │
│ │IO12│     │ ⚠BOOT    │IO4  │    │        │
│ │GND │ GND │          │IO0  │    │ ⚠BOOT  │
│ │IO13│     │          │IO2  │    │ ⚠BOOT  │
│ │D2  │FLASH│◄NO USE   │IO15 │    │ ⚠BOOT  │
│ │D3  │FLASH│◄NO USE   │D1   │FLASH◄NO USE│
│ │CMD │FLASH│◄NO USE   │D0   │FLASH◄NO USE│
│ │5V  │ VIN │          │CLK  │FLASH◄NO USE│
│ └────┴─────┘          └─────┴────┘        │
│                                           │
│ ⚠ = Strapping pin (affects boot mode)    │
│ ◄IN ONLY = Input only, no pull-up        │
│ ◄NO USE = Internal flash, DO NOT USE     │
└───────────────────────────────────────────┘
ascii_pinouts.74hc595:
┌───────────────────────────────┐
│      74HC595 Shift Register   │
│                               │
│      ┌─────┬─U─┬─────┐        │
│  QB ─┤1         16├─ VCC      │
│  QC ─┤2         15├─ QA       │
│  QD ─┤3         14├─ DS (SER) │
│  QE ─┤4   595   13├─ OE       │
│  QF ─┤5         12├─ STCP     │
│  QG ─┤6         11├─ SHCP     │
│  QH ─┤7         10├─ MR       │
│ GND ─┤8          9├─ QH'      │
│      └───────────┘            │
│                               │
│ Pin 14 (DS/SER)  = Data In    │
│ Pin 11 (SHCP)    = Shift Clock│
│ Pin 12 (STCP)    = Latch Clock│
│ Pin 13 (OE)      = Output En  │
│ Pin 10 (MR)      = Master Rst │
│ Pin 9  (QH')     = Serial Out │
│ Pins 1-7,15      = Outputs    │
│                               │
│ Typical: OE→GND, MR→VCC       │
└───────────────────────────────┘

arduino_uno_blink.description: Basic LED blink - verify board works

schema_definition.description: JSON Schema for Electronics Inventory optimized for AI wiring diagram generation

operating_voltage_v.note: number for single, object for range {min, max}

signals.description: Pin name to signal type mapping

category_definitions.sensors: Input devices that measure physical quantities
category_definitions.actuators: Output devices that create motion or force
category_definitions.displays: Visual output devices (LCD, LED matrix, TFT)
